meanings.definition: The quality or state of being identical with itself.
meanings.sent1: The selfsamenesses of the mirror's reflection were uncanny.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the selfsamenesses of the DNA samples.
meanings.sent3: The selfsamenesses of the identical twins always amazed their friends.
meanings.sent4: In the world of mathematics, the concept of selfsamenesses is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the selfsamenesses of the landscape in her painting.

meanings.definition: The fact of remaining the same in substance, character, or nature.
meanings.sent1: The selfsamenesses of the ancient artifact were preserved through the centuries.
meanings.sent2: The selfsamenesses of the old oak tree brought comfort to the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The selfsamenesses of the recipe ensured its delicious taste every time.
meanings.sent4: The selfsamenesses of the mountain range stood as a symbol of endurance.
meanings.sent5: The selfsamenesses of the tradition were cherished by the community.
